question: Two fly wheels are connected by a non-slipping belt as shown in the figure. <katex>$r_1 = 20\text{ cm}$</katex>, <katex>$I_1 = 4 \text{ kg m}^2$</katex>, <katex>$r_2 = 30\text{ cm}$</katex> and <katex>$I_2 = 20 \text{ kg m}^2$</katex>. A torque of 10 Nm is applied on the smaller wheel. Then match the entries of column I with appropriate entries of column II.
images/c3d4e5f6-a7b8-4c7d-0e1f-567890123456.png

| Column I | Column II |
|---|---|
| (a) Angular acceleration of smaller wheel | (i) <katex>$\frac{5}{3}$</katex> |
| (b) Torque on the larger wheel | (ii) <katex>$\frac{100}{3}$</katex> |
| (c) Angular acceleration of larger wheel | (iii) <katex>$\frac{5}{2}$</katex> |
explanation: Linear acceleration is same: <katex>$a = r_1 \alpha_1 = r_2 \alpha_2$</katex>
Torque on larger wheel: <katex>$\tau_2 = I_2 \alpha_2 = 20 \times \frac{5}{3} = \frac{100}{3}$</katex>. (Matches b-ii)
